page.title: 01Introduction.
page.content: The area studied is the N.E. sector of Hawick, a Scottish Border Town famous for high quality knitwear, a formidable Rugby Union Team - the "Greens", and a passionate support of local traditions climaxed in the "Common Riding". Set amid rolling Border Hills on the banks of the River Teviot (a tributory of the River Tweed), this town of l6,5OO people, successfully combines a country emvironment with those of a busy manufacturing and market town. The sector coveredd is representative of the town in that it contains rough hill grazing, pastureland, commercial, residential and industrial areas. However in addition to these "typical" areas the sector is unique in that it contains the largest housing estate in the Borders, Burnfoot, which comprises lOOl houses.
